text: Hi there! I’ve a blogpost with an edited publish date in the past. On the page itself, it displays the set date. But on the listing page, it shows a different date. While they both use {{ content.publish_date }}. Anyone knows if its a bug?

Hello HubSpoters, I'd like to achieve a layout in a dnd area where the form overlaps the section below it. See screenshot. What's the fastest/easiest way to achieve this? I'd like to preserve the full dnd capability of both sections, if possible... Thanks. This screenshot is of the "Starter" template "Compass". I doesn't look like I have access to the code, or I'd just look at that...
<@U03MU3H35R6> Thank you, I will take a look at my code and trim it!
I figured it out. If you apply negative margin to the column (in the WSIWYG editor), it achieves the desired result.

Anyone know if you can pre-populate fields on a payment link with query parameters? I know this works for HubSpot meetings links, but I was messing around with a payment link and it doesn’t seem to work. (ex: <https://app.HubSpot.com/payments/purchase/hscs_12345678?tickets=2> would auto-populate the number of tickets)

<@U04AQA0QM8E> Thank you for looking into this further, and others as well for your input and fixes. I will try `widget_data.background_image.img.src` when I have time to work on this template again. You are appreciated!
REPEATER FILEDS:  Does anyone know if there is a MAX limit on the number of objects that can be included in a repeater if the max is set to `null`?  Is it 100 or can this basically go until infinity?
